Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark registration can be maintained for all listed wares under Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Stage: Appeal from decision of Trademarks Opposition Board
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant provided new evidence of use for most wares; insufficient evidence for 'threads'
Decision_Outcome: Trademark registration maintained but amended to remove 'threads'
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate use of trademark for each ware
Legal_Rule: Registration may be expunged or amended if no use shown within three years under Section 45
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of use of trademark for 'threads'
Outcome_on_Merits: Appeal allowed in part; registration upheld for most wares, removed for 'threads'
Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence of use of trademark for various wares, except 'threads'
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged amendment decision by Trademarks Opposition Board
Court_Result: Allowed appeal, reinstated most wares, removed 'threads'
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Remedy_Requested: Maintain trademark registration for all wares
Remedy_Sought: Amendment of registration to reflect actual use
Applicable_Process: Ex parte appeal with submission of additional evidence
Governing_Rule: Section 45 requires use within three years or risk expungement
